code:
export const plants = [{
  id: 1,
  name: "Monstera Deliciosa",
  scientificName: "Monstera deliciosa",
  image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1600411833117-07db6ddfed9b",
  shortDescription: "Iconic tropical plant with distinctive split leaves",
  careLevel: "Medium",
  category: "Tropical",
  details: {
    description: "The Monstera Deliciosa, also known as the Swiss Cheese Plant, is a stunning tropical plant native to Central America. Its large, glossy leaves develop characteristic splits and holes as they mature, creating a dramatic and architectural presence in any space.",
    careInstructions: {
      light: "Bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight which can scorch the leaves.",
      water: "Water when the top inch of soil is dry. Typically every 1-2 weeks.",
      humidity: "Prefers high humidity (60-80%). Mist regularly or use a humidifier.",
      temperature: "65-85°F (18-29°C). Avoid temperatures below 60°F (15°C).",
      soil: "Well-draining potting mix with good aeration.",
      fertilizer: "Feed monthly during growing season with balanced houseplant fertilizer."
    },
    commonProblems: ["Yellow leaves: Usually indicates overwatering", "Brown leaf edges: Low humidity or underwatering", "No leaf splits: Insufficient light"],
    propagation: "Can be propagated through stem cuttings with aerial roots",
    toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets and humans if ingested"
  }
}, {
  id: 2,
  name: "Snake Plant",
  scientificName: "Sansevieria trifasciata",
  image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
  shortDescription: "Hardy, air-purifying plant perfect for beginners",
  careLevel: "Easy",
  category: "Succulent",
  details: {
    description: "The Snake Plant, also known as Mother-in-Law's Tongue, is one of the most resilient houseplants. It's known for its striking upright leaves and exceptional air-purifying qualities, making it perfect for both homes and offices.",
    careInstructions: {
      light: "Tolerates low light but thrives in bright, indirect light",
      water: "Water every 2-3 weeks. Allow soil to dry completely between waterings",
      humidity: "Tolerates low humidity well",
      temperature: "60-85°F (15-29°C). Can tolerate lower temperatures",
      soil: "Well-draining cactus or succulent mix",
      fertilizer: "Feed lightly every 2-3 months during growing season"
    },
    commonProblems: ["Root rot: Caused by overwatering", "Soft, mushy leaves: Sign of overwatering", "Brown tips: Usually due to underwatering or low humidity"],
    propagation: "Easy to propagate through leaf cuttings or division",
    toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets if ingested"
  }
}, {
  id: 3,
  name: "Fiddle Leaf Fig",
  scientificName: "Ficus lyrata",
  image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596462502278-27bfdc403348",
  shortDescription: "Dramatic statement plant with large, violin-shaped leaves",
  careLevel: "Hard",
  category: "Tropical",
  details: {
    description: "The Fiddle Leaf Fig is a stunning tropical plant known for its large, glossy, violin-shaped leaves. While it requires more attention than some plants, its dramatic presence makes it a favorite among plant enthusiasts.",
    careInstructions: {
      light: "Bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight",
      water: "Water when top inch of soil is dry. Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy",
      humidity: "Prefers high humidity (60-80%)",
      temperature: "65-75°F (18-24°C). Avoid drafts and temperature fluctuations",
      soil: "Rich, well-draining potting mix",
      fertilizer: "Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer"
    },
    commonProblems: ["Leaf drop: Usually due to overwatering or sudden changes in environment", "Brown spots: Often caused by overwatering or poor water quality", "Yellow leaves: Can indicate overwatering or nutrient deficiency"],
    propagation: "Can be propagated through stem cuttings",
    toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets if ingested"
  }
}, {
  id: 4,
  name: "String of Pearls",
  scientificName: "Senecio rowleyanus",
  image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
  shortDescription: "Unique trailing succulent with spherical leaves",
  careLevel: "Medium",
  category: "Succulent",
  details: {
    description: "The String of Pearls is a unique trailing succulent that features small, spherical leaves resembling pearls. It's perfect for hanging baskets or high shelves where its trailing stems can cascade down.",
    careInstructions: {
      light: "Bright, indirect light. Can tolerate some direct morning sun",
      water: "Water when soil is completely dry. Reduce watering in winter",
      humidity: "Tolerates low humidity well",
      temperature: "70-80°F (21-27°C). Protect from cold drafts",
      soil: "Well-draining cactus or succulent mix",
      fertilizer: "Feed lightly every 2-3 months during growing season"
    },
    commonProblems: ["Shriveling pearls: Sign of underwatering", "Yellow pearls: Usually indicates overwatering", "Stretched growth: Insufficient light"],
    propagation: "Easy to propagate through stem cuttings",
    toxicity: "Toxic to pets if ingested"
  }
}, {
  id: 5,
  name: "Bird of Paradise",
  scientificName: "Strelitzia reginae",
  image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
  shortDescription: "Tropical plant with large, banana-like leaves",
  careLevel: "Medium",
  category: "Tropical",
  details: {
    description: "The Bird of Paradise is a stunning tropical plant known for its large, banana-like leaves and exotic flowers. It adds a dramatic tropical touch to any space and can grow quite large with proper care.",
    careInstructions: {
      light: "Bright, indirect to direct light. Can tolerate some direct sun",
      water: "Water when top inch of soil is dry. Keep soil consistently moist",
      humidity: "Prefers moderate to high humidity",
      temperature: "65-80°F (18-27°C). Protect from cold drafts",
      soil: "Rich, well-draining potting mix",
      fertilizer: "Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer"
    },
    commonProblems: ["Split leaves: Normal in mature plants", "Brown leaf edges: Low humidity or underwatering", "No flowers: Usually due to insufficient light or young age"],
    propagation: "Can be propagated through division",
    toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets if ingested"
  }
}, {
  id: 6,
  name: "ZZ Plant",
  scientificName: "Zamioculcas zamiifolia",
  image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
  shortDescription: "Low-maintenance plant with glossy, dark green leaves",
  careLevel: "Easy",
  category: "Tropical",
  details: {
    description: "The ZZ Plant is an incredibly resilient plant known for its glossy, dark green leaves and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. It's perfect for busy plant parents or those new to plant care.",
    careInstructions: {
      light: "Tolerates low light but grows best in bright, indirect light",
      water: "Water every 2-3 weeks. Allow soil to dry between waterings",
      humidity: "Tolerates low humidity well",
      temperature: "65-75°F (18-24°C). Can tolerate lower temperatures",
      soil: "Well-draining potting mix",
      fertilizer: "Feed lightly every 2-3 months during growing season"
    },
    commonProblems: ["Yellow leaves: Usually indicates overwatering", "Stretched growth: Insufficient light", "Brown tips: Can indicate underwatering or low humidity"],
    propagation: "Can be propagated through leaf cuttings or division",
    toxicity: "Toxic to pets if ingested"
  }
}];

sourcesContent:
export const plants = [
  {
    id: 1,
    name: "Monstera Deliciosa",
    scientificName: "Monstera deliciosa",
    image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1600411833117-07db6ddfed9b",
    shortDescription: "Iconic tropical plant with distinctive split leaves",
    careLevel: "Medium",
    category: "Tropical",
    details: {
      description: "The Monstera Deliciosa, also known as the Swiss Cheese Plant, is a stunning tropical plant native to Central America. Its large, glossy leaves develop characteristic splits and holes as they mature, creating a dramatic and architectural presence in any space.",
      careInstructions: {
        light: "Bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight which can scorch the leaves.",
        water: "Water when the top inch of soil is dry. Typically every 1-2 weeks.",
        humidity: "Prefers high humidity (60-80%). Mist regularly or use a humidifier.",
        temperature: "65-85°F (18-29°C). Avoid temperatures below 60°F (15°C).",
        soil: "Well-draining potting mix with good aeration.",
        fertilizer: "Feed monthly during growing season with balanced houseplant fertilizer."
      },
      commonProblems: [
        "Yellow leaves: Usually indicates overwatering",
        "Brown leaf edges: Low humidity or underwatering",
        "No leaf splits: Insufficient light"
      ],
      propagation: "Can be propagated through stem cuttings with aerial roots",
      toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets and humans if ingested"
    }
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    name: "Snake Plant",
    scientificName: "Sansevieria trifasciata",
    image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
    shortDescription: "Hardy, air-purifying plant perfect for beginners",
    careLevel: "Easy",
    category: "Succulent",
    details: {
      description: "The Snake Plant, also known as Mother-in-Law's Tongue, is one of the most resilient houseplants. It's known for its striking upright leaves and exceptional air-purifying qualities, making it perfect for both homes and offices.",
      careInstructions: {
        light: "Tolerates low light but thrives in bright, indirect light",
        water: "Water every 2-3 weeks. Allow soil to dry completely between waterings",
        humidity: "Tolerates low humidity well",
        temperature: "60-85°F (15-29°C). Can tolerate lower temperatures",
        soil: "Well-draining cactus or succulent mix",
        fertilizer: "Feed lightly every 2-3 months during growing season"
      },
      commonProblems: [
        "Root rot: Caused by overwatering",
        "Soft, mushy leaves: Sign of overwatering",
        "Brown tips: Usually due to underwatering or low humidity"
      ],
      propagation: "Easy to propagate through leaf cuttings or division",
      toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets if ingested"
    }
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    name: "Fiddle Leaf Fig",
    scientificName: "Ficus lyrata",
    image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596462502278-27bfdc403348",
    shortDescription: "Dramatic statement plant with large, violin-shaped leaves",
    careLevel: "Hard",
    category: "Tropical",
    details: {
      description: "The Fiddle Leaf Fig is a stunning tropical plant known for its large, glossy, violin-shaped leaves. While it requires more attention than some plants, its dramatic presence makes it a favorite among plant enthusiasts.",
      careInstructions: {
        light: "Bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight",
        water: "Water when top inch of soil is dry. Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy",
        humidity: "Prefers high humidity (60-80%)",
        temperature: "65-75°F (18-24°C). Avoid drafts and temperature fluctuations",
        soil: "Rich, well-draining potting mix",
        fertilizer: "Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer"
      },
      commonProblems: [
        "Leaf drop: Usually due to overwatering or sudden changes in environment",
        "Brown spots: Often caused by overwatering or poor water quality",
        "Yellow leaves: Can indicate overwatering or nutrient deficiency"
      ],
      propagation: "Can be propagated through stem cuttings",
      toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets if ingested"
    }
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    name: "String of Pearls",
    scientificName: "Senecio rowleyanus",
    image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
    shortDescription: "Unique trailing succulent with spherical leaves",
    careLevel: "Medium",
    category: "Succulent",
    details: {
      description: "The String of Pearls is a unique trailing succulent that features small, spherical leaves resembling pearls. It's perfect for hanging baskets or high shelves where its trailing stems can cascade down.",
      careInstructions: {
        light: "Bright, indirect light. Can tolerate some direct morning sun",
        water: "Water when soil is completely dry. Reduce watering in winter",
        humidity: "Tolerates low humidity well",
        temperature: "70-80°F (21-27°C). Protect from cold drafts",
        soil: "Well-draining cactus or succulent mix",
        fertilizer: "Feed lightly every 2-3 months during growing season"
      },
      commonProblems: [
        "Shriveling pearls: Sign of underwatering",
        "Yellow pearls: Usually indicates overwatering",
        "Stretched growth: Insufficient light"
      ],
      propagation: "Easy to propagate through stem cuttings",
      toxicity: "Toxic to pets if ingested"
    }
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    name: "Bird of Paradise",
    scientificName: "Strelitzia reginae",
    image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
    shortDescription: "Tropical plant with large, banana-like leaves",
    careLevel: "Medium",
    category: "Tropical",
    details: {
      description: "The Bird of Paradise is a stunning tropical plant known for its large, banana-like leaves and exotic flowers. It adds a dramatic tropical touch to any space and can grow quite large with proper care.",
      careInstructions: {
        light: "Bright, indirect to direct light. Can tolerate some direct sun",
        water: "Water when top inch of soil is dry. Keep soil consistently moist",
        humidity: "Prefers moderate to high humidity",
        temperature: "65-80°F (18-27°C). Protect from cold drafts",
        soil: "Rich, well-draining potting mix",
        fertilizer: "Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer"
      },
      commonProblems: [
        "Split leaves: Normal in mature plants",
        "Brown leaf edges: Low humidity or underwatering",
        "No flowers: Usually due to insufficient light or young age"
      ],
      propagation: "Can be propagated through division",
      toxicity: "Mildly toxic to pets if ingested"
    }
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    name: "ZZ Plant",
    scientificName: "Zamioculcas zamiifolia",
    image: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596547609652-9cf5d8c10d6e",
    shortDescription: "Low-maintenance plant with glossy, dark green leaves",
    careLevel: "Easy",
    category: "Tropical",
    details: {
      description: "The ZZ Plant is an incredibly resilient plant known for its glossy, dark green leaves and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. It's perfect for busy plant parents or those new to plant care.",
      careInstructions: {
        light: "Tolerates low light but grows best in bright, indirect light",
        water: "Water every 2-3 weeks. Allow soil to dry between waterings",
        humidity: "Tolerates low humidity well",
        temperature: "65-75°F (18-24°C). Can tolerate lower temperatures",
        soil: "Well-draining potting mix",
        fertilizer: "Feed lightly every 2-3 months during growing season"
      },
      commonProblems: [
        "Yellow leaves: Usually indicates overwatering",
        "Stretched growth: Insufficient light",
        "Brown tips: Can indicate underwatering or low humidity"
      ],
      propagation: "Can be propagated through leaf cuttings or division",
      toxicity: "Toxic to pets if ingested"
    }
  }
];
